headline: Bank of America Puts Three Executives in Front of CEO Succession Race
summary: Bank of America  appointed two new co-presidents and elevated the title of its chief financial officer Friday, moves that identify them as the most likely potential successors for longtime Chief Executive  Brian Moynihan.  The bank tapped  Dean Athanasia,  who leads the consumer and commercial banking operations, and  Jim DeMare,  who runs the global markets division, as the co-presidents of the entire bank.  CFO  Alastair Borthwick  was given the title of executive vice president.

raw.headline: Bank of America Puts Three Executives in Front of CEO Succession Race
raw.summary: Bank of America  appointed two new co-presidents and elevated the title of its chief financial officer Friday, moves that identify them as the most likely potential successors for longtime Chief Executive  Brian Moynihan.  The bank tapped  Dean Athanasia,  who leads the consumer and commercial banking operations, and  Jim DeMare,  who runs the global markets division, as the co-presidents of the entire bank.  CFO  Alastair Borthwick  was given the title of executive vice president.

headline: Bank of America Elevates CEO Contenders in Management Shuffle
summary: Bank of America  Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan has named two longtime executives as co-presidents and plans to expand its chief financial officer’s role in the bank’s most significant set of senior management changes in four years.  The moves spotlight three leaders who are viewed internally and across the banking industry as potential successors to Moynihan, who has run the second-largest U.S. lender since 2010.  In a memo outlining the changes on Friday, Moynihan said he plans to stay in his role through the next decade, or to 2030, reiterating guidance he has shared with employees in recent years.

raw.headline: Bank of America Elevates CEO Contenders in Management Shuffle

The moves spotlight three leaders who are viewed internally and across the banking industry as potential successors to Moynihan, who has run the second-largest U.S. lender since 2010.  In a memo outlining the changes on Friday, Moynihan said he plans to stay in his role through the next decade, or to 2030, reiterating guidance he has shared with employees in recent years.

headline: Bank of America CEO Appoints Co-Presidents
summary: The bank said that Chair and CEO Brian Moynihan has tapped Dean Athanasia and Jim DeMare for the co-president roles. CFO Alastair Borthwick is now also the company’s executive vice president.

raw.headline: Bank of America CEO Appoints Co-Presidents
raw.summary: The bank said that Chair and CEO Brian Moynihan has tapped Dean Athanasia and Jim DeMare for the co-president roles. CFO Alastair Borthwick is now also the company’s executive vice president.

headline: Bank of America Plans Shake-Up of Senior Leadership Ranks
summary: Bank of America is planning a shake-up of its senior leadership ranks in a move that narrows the slate of leaders who could one day succeed long-time CEO Brian Moynihan. The discussion involves expanding the role of Jim DeMare, who runs the firm's trading business, along with promotions for other senior leaders, according to people with knowledge of the matter. Sridhar Natarajan has more on "Bloomberg The Close."

headline: Bank of America (BAC) To Redeem €2 Billion Floating Rate Senior Notes
summary: Bank of America (BAC) recently announced the redemption of €2 billion in senior notes, reflecting a careful approach to its debt obligations. Over the last quarter, BAC's shares moved up 15%, a notable change amidst broader market dynamics where indexes, like the Nasdaq, touched record highs. This upward movement gains further context from the company's latest quarterly earnings, which reported increased net interest income and net income, reinforcing investor confidence. Additional weight...

headline: Why BofA says TOPIX and Nikkei have more room to run

headline: Bank of America Announces Redemption of €2,000,000,000 of Floating Rate Senior Notes, Due September 22, 2026
summary: Bank of America Corporation announced today that it will redeem on September 22, 2025 all €2,000,000,000 principal amount outstanding of its Floating Rate Senior Notes, due September 22, 2026 (ISIN: XS2387929834; Common Code: 238792983) (the "Notes").
